subject: AI & Agents
title: Anomaly Detection: Finding the Outliers
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Anomaly Detection: Finding the Outliers.

hook.text: One transaction among a billion doesn't fit the pattern. It might be fraud. Anomaly detection finds it.

buildup.text: The model learns what 'normal' looks like, then flags anything that deviates significantly.

discovery.text: Autoencoders learn to compress and reconstruct normal data. Anomalies reconstruct poorly.

twist.text: The definition of 'anomaly' changes over time. What's unusual today may be normal tomorrow.

climax.text: Anomaly detection guards networks, catches fraud, and monitors industrial equipment.

punchline.text: Learn what's normal. Everything else is suspicious.

quiz.question: How does anomaly detection work?
options: By learning normal patterns and flagging deviations
By labeling every data point as normal or abnormal
